sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message: DEs have same pay range as SE till senior level. Lead DEs have interacted with both analysts and DS and business folks to integrate their perspectives in their work (this is really difficult to do) and hence really rare to find so they go higher 15-25% than Lead SE. I‚Äôve seen lead DEs with 7 yrs+ making 50-70L. This is usually around 40-55L with SE.

I took a 5 month break between my previous 2 jobs. I had worked for almost 5 years in a mental health startup. I was so mentally drained that it just wasn't possible for me to work effectively at a new job without a break. So I moved to my hometown for 5 months. Used that time to rest A LOT to mentally rejuvenate. It was also the longest time I spent with my parents in some 14 years and also reconnected with old school friends after 16-17 years. It was much needed and so refreshing

Hello Swapna, Each Hiring Manager would need a different set of data for them to update the management, So we would create a report specific to each hiring manager and share it with them. Initially, We kept a live sheet shared with the hiring managers and directed the recruiters to capture the data accordingly. This would help the hiring managers to pull out whatever data they wanted. That way it is easy. Later we created a report format on our ATS and created a email rule where the link of the report would hit their inbox daily

Role we worked for the week
No of profiles shared
No of Shortlisted profiles
Shortlisting pending
No of interviews scheduled (Round wise to get better idea of progress)
Interview feedbacks pending
Selection for the week
Joining for the week
Offer declined with reason

-Employees benefited from both professional certifications and courses in the field of Development, Testing, Design, Cloud, Marketing and HR enhancing their skills and qualifications. Reimbursement policy was a game changer.
 
-Wednesday wisdom  sessions facilitated knowledge sharing among all levels of employees be it be (L1, L2 and L3). Also, we saw initiatives led by junior folks to deliver such sessions (Confidence booster)

-Accelerated the adoption of new technologies within the workforce which has drived the existing employees to work on continuous learning and development.

-Exposure to Industry Conferences and Webinars is playing a vital role for our employees into improving  their (interpersonal, networking and communication skills)

sender: GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto
message: We did negotiate with all the 3 service providers. I felt Plum was the fastest and easiest to communicate. They came up with a plan best suited for us and recommended it. Pazcare dropped in between the discussions, as they could not match Plum and Nova Benefits had very limited options and were 10% higher in the quote
Did you evaluate Onsurity also? Any other providers?

sender: GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto
message: Onsurity were not open for a Startup of 10 employees are less

sender: GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto
message: When you are going for a Group Medical Policy, it is always good to go with the Service Provider who gives the best price upfront, as we will not have details of claims and the number of employees you can project in a Startup like ours. Then from the 2nd year we will have some data, then we can negotiate based on that with all the service providers

So for us we had past data but lucky out claim rate for my last startup were favourable for us and that lead to a better rate 
Now before that we had a crazy high claim rate so it shot up our premium to 40 % high and then we did crazy bargains to come to a good number

Sharing some more names of providers that keep cropping up in discussions:
Loop
Acko
Marsh <This message was edited>
More than the price it's important to look at the claim settlement. Soo many have gone with providers that give a better rate but then when it comes to actual claims, it's an issue.

A Big Thank You üòä

Thanks a ton for taking time to fill our Survey Form last week, to tell us your current pain points on gifting-as-a-service in your organization. We only circulated it among our warm contacts and received ~50 responses in 3 days which reconfirms our doubts on broken experience in delighting your employees/clients/partners with gifting!! We are in nascent stages right now and your inputs are largely helping us shape our gifting platform, a warm thank you üòä For transparency, we attached results of the survey with this write-up.

We are building Amy Gifting as an online platform specializing in bulk gifting solutions for corporates, SMEs and Start-ups. We aim to provide a seamless experience for businesses looking to streamline and automate their gifting processes, offering a wide range of curated/exclusive/exquisite products, customizable options, and end-to-end trackable logistics. 

Thoughtful gifts evoke positive emotions in our minds, we strongly believe that!!

We observed that orgs. spend money on gifting with no measurable success metrics as outcome. We aim to introduce ‚ÄòEmployee satisfaction score‚Äô as a success metric to report to the gifting org., To do this, we start with collecting feedback (text & video formats) from gift recipients on your behalf. 

This is just one feature, we are sure that we will come up with many more such cool features as we keep executing orders. 

If you are interested to be part of our exciting journey from day 1, and be kind enough to help us from your experience, associate with us by sharing your email here https://forms.gle/eLc68fPdyVtT26Fu8 We will make you part of our close-group of amazing Founders, HR Heads, Function Heads, EAs and Senior Executives. We know the value of your time, so all that we will do is email you 2-3 line pointers on our weekly progress. If you find that we are moving in a wrong direction, correct us, if not, just read and close the email üòä We are a small and agile team at the moment, who eagerly want to learn and improve from your inputs, and ofcourse you will get your well-deserved perks in the form of discounts when we go live üòä

Write to us anytime, anyday on anything manasa@amygifting.com

Hello there HRRoes
It's the first day of the new financial year!
Yup can totally feel it.
For so many of us, it's a day of renewals or even fresh starts in our professional journeys
So all the best folks. Kill it this FY2024-25
And thank you for making RR a part of your journey
A community is it's members
We're constantly working as admins to make sure this community i.e. all of us are able to make the most of it and grow into something that fuels your own growth

With this mind we wanted to formally share some community guidelines which were being followed informally anyway. The idea here is for everyone feel as comfortable as possible, protecting member privacy, and promoting learning

Community Guidelines
1. Be professional
2. Treat others online as you would treat them in real life
3. Be tolerant towards others‚Äô viewpoints; respectfully disagree when opinions do not align
4. Respect the privacy and personal information of other community members
5. Communicate with courtesy and respect

6. Avoid using the group for DMs - If there‚Äôs a topic that only concerns you and one other person, please DM them about it.
7. Strictly NO BUSINESS or EVENT PROMOTIONS allowed in the community without the ADMIN'S EXPRESS APPROVAL
8. Strictly NO SPAM
9. Please keep your posts in any group on-topic

10. DO NOT share any member‚Äôs contact details with a 3rd party without their express consent
11. Do not DM other members for sales purposes without their permission, unless you have a pre-existing relationship with them

12. The other community groups in this community are as follows:
- Jobs Board: Group for you to post job openings as well as CVs for referrals.
- Chit-Chat: Our chill space where we can discuss anything under the sun
13. Most Importantly: HAVE FUN!
We will periodically share these guidelines in this group just as a gentle reminder
Thank you folks

Helps, we have tried this, if a person is unsure they will
Push collecting the laptop

A few companies have done that in past, say CRED till date gives the laptop before joining.

This generally reduces the drop out ratio but if someone doesn‚Äôt join, they generally send the laptop back or you‚Äôll have to arrange for a pick up.

We've not really faced this issue. We usually reach out to the candidate a week before their joining - once they share their address, we are fairly certain they'll join and then ship it across

Has anyone used Skillate and Talent Recruit as ATS? One of my connections is exploring them and wanted feedback
I am using Skillate
How's the feedback? Positive and Negative points that we should know?
Easy to use , candidate management flow is also pretty simple , allows customisation, reporting is also pretty simple
Am also using it
Agreed..same feedback
Their support is also good
After sense has acquired them they have come with a whole new features which can be explored but from basic ATS utilisation it‚Äôs cheap and good
Serves the purpose
It's good tool if your hiring numbers are <100
Just one draw back I see is when a company is looking for a tool which has HRMS and ATS both as functionality where any standalone ATS unless u pay for integration won‚Äôt serve the purpose
Per month hiring or in a quarter?
This is yearly hiring. When did monthly 100 hires become a normal thing in the market üòÖ
Yearly..with some buffer it can be around 130-140
üòÅüòÅ

I have also used ATS.
It is a good tool.
A lot of customization can be done, reporting and advance reporting is good, and it is easy to understand.
There was a time when this was a realityüôà
Monthly üßêüßê
Yes, in Zeta
ShareChat in 2021 too

We used it & used to hire 400 a month. The thing with Skillate is that it is a no frills ATS. Strong on the product side, no issues at you build but reports were not the best. We however took the raw data & built everything on Tableau so it didn't matter much.

Integration is decent but given newer players have not yet integrated with every HRMS or other adjacent HR systems, that can get a bit tricky..

*Packets of Purpose* is a food donation drive in which people volunteer to craft packets of ration supplies for the underprivileged. We do not ask for donations from anyone, just their time - to come together as a community and spend time physically working for this cause. 

The act of working hands-on for an extended period strengthens the virtue of giving back to society. Volunteers work together to distribute these packets in underprivileged areas, engaging with the community and reinforcing the importance of giving back. 

Our next donation drive is on Sunday, April 28, 2024 in Gurgaon. People interested in volunteering can join this Whatsapp group (serious participants only): https://chat.whatsapp.com/GzhK5FABOHAHLV097gP5zq

Community Guidelines
1. Be professional
2. Treat others online as you would treat them in real life
3. Be tolerant towards others‚Äô viewpoints; respectfully disagree when opinions do not align
4. Respect the privacy and personal information of other community members

8. Strictly NO SPAM
9. Please keep your posts in any group on-topic

10. DO NOT share any member‚Äôs contact details with a 3rd party without their express consent
11. Do not DM other members for sales purposes without their permission, unless you have a pre-existing relationship with them

12. The other community groups in this community are as follows:
- Jobs Board: Group for you to post job openings as well as CVs for referrals.

Everytime I've made a job post for Video Editors it is largely super talented Malayali applicants 
For Directors or Script Writers - Bengali or Marathi applicants
For Production - Kannada and Hindi speaking folks of Delhi applicants.
The probability of picking them for the job is higher than the probability of getting extra 15 days to fill a certain diversity quota. As a recruiter I have obligations to the business and every hour the vacancy stays open the more we burn money.

There is plenty nuance to this, but this is definitely a pain point.

Hey folks!
I've been chatting with fellow TA professional whom I know personally with an average experience of 4years (so is mine). All of us seem to be at the cross roads of choosing to stay in the same function or pick up a different function with transferable skills we already have.

message: From both skill and team perspective

That's what I told, it needs to be tailor made. 

And 6-7 years back things would have been different, and now if you see these competency would change. I have seen in few orgs, where junior folks are already doing great stakeholder management, employee engagement and many other things which falls under the lead category, but can we give that title? Answer would be possibly no, even if the answer goes yes to some extent, will they be paid at that level, answer - definitely no. One of the junior folk I'm only mentoring, and she is doing amazingly good, and she is already coming to a lead "as per the framework shared", but she is not. 

I'm not saying it's bad, or not disrespecting the fact from wherever it is coming from. 

What I meant is these framework needs to be tailor made to suit org needs. And, to do some more research on current standards. There needs to be an intent. 

Yaha sab kuch change ho rha hai, tech standards are changing drastically, why not TA frameworks.

Hi all, had a few questions to ask because we're trying to streamline our inbound hiring channel. Would love to understand your views on this. 

1. What are the hiring platforms you use for non tech mid to senior hiring and frontline sales hiring?
2. How do you solve the problems of receiving a lot of junk/irrelevant profiles in your inbound and how do you optimise for attracting more relevant profiles?
3. How do you sift through the inbound profiles? Do add a friction in process like a form to be filled or by linking the platform application and ATS which then auto sifts through these profiles? 
4. On an average, how many positions are closed by inbound applications?

sender: Kshitij Gupta Lead TA Global Pixis. Ai
message:
1. LinkedIn
2. Add questionnaires to filter out irrelevant ones
3. Yes application form with few questions specifically on their experience, kind or clients and domain they worked for, their target achievement etc
4. Depends in last org we closed all roles in house out of which 60% got closed via inbound applications. For tech this number is lower

sender: Shruti Goyal Associate Manager TA Aidetic
message:
Hi all, had a few questions to ask because we're trying to streamline our inbound hiring channel. Would love to understand your views on this. 

1. What are the hiring platforms you use for non tech mid to senior hiring and frontline sales hiring? - the channels you can inticrate with your current ATS tool  - like LinkedIn, IIM jobs , Naukri portal and other job boards like indeed .
2. How do you solve the problems of receiving a lot of junk/irrelevant profiles in your inbound and how do you optimise for attracting more relevant profiles? 
It‚Äôs always to put a filter on your search profiles under every position that is posted through the ATS platform. Your life will become easy if you inticrate/direct all the profiles to one sourcing point. Now those candidates who don‚Äôt qualify those key skills set, put them to reject section and send the email to them.

3. How do you sift through the inbound profiles? Do add a friction in process like a form to be filled or by linking the platform application and ATS which then auto sifts through these profiles? 
Genrally we have a section of internal referrals, where the details of current employees and the referral‚Äôs email is shared. You can streamline it. 


4. On an average, how many positions are closed by inbound applications?
Depends on how actively you are working on it.

sender: Jaya Bhardwaj Sr. TA Manager Vimeo
message:
This is based on what has worked for me.

1. LinkedIn works best for non Tech roles, specifically for Sales hirings Mid to Sr. roles, you will find great talent and you can tap them fast with Premium access.
I have also used Indeed free version for this, though it sends some irrelevant ones too. So a bit time consuming if you are ready to spend time.
2. Filter works great in ATS like Greenhouse to weed out irrelevant profiles by creating rules while posting a Job. This can also be solved by sending a quick job form manually/automatically at an Application review stage.
3. The mandatory filter/ questionnaires helps manage pipeline effectively.

message: In a fast paced Startup, TAT for closures has to be less than 45 days. Each recruiter can manage 5-7 Requirements divided based on Priority for each role. https://www.linkedin.com/posts/gunjan-das-081514b4_recruitment-hiring-talentacquisition-activity-7196376582398054402-ZRy3?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop

Someone asked about hiring metrics.

You could use:
1. Cost Per Hire  
2. Time to Start - The average time taken from when the position opens till a candidate is selected and joins. 
3. TIme to Productivity - The average time taken from when the position opens till they can match the level of productivity of an employee who's been in the system at a similar level. 
_The last two help you reverse calculate how early you need to start looking for candidates for planned hiring._
4. Screen to Offer - This is from the time a candidate is screened (in case of outbound search) till they are sent an offer. We try to keep this <7 working days. 

Most of our searches are indeed outbound, we search on LinkedIn, pick up numbers from Naukri. 

We use Zoho One, so Zoho People as an HRMS and Zoho Recruit as the ATS. 

The biggest advantage of an ATS which I find is having your own mini database. I remember speaking with the Bigshyft guys when they were quite new, and it's always good to ask who are you not good enough for üòÖ. They said Amazon is a pain, they already have profiles of every candidate we send them in their database. 

Which brings me to the other point this group is discussing, inbound applications are directly linked with your employer branding, if you are a recognisable brand in the industry, your inbound applications will be enough to close positions else outbound searches and recruitment vendor empanelment is what you'd need. Hope this helps. <This message was edited>

sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message:
Neha, I ran a meetup community in Pune for purely employer brand + quality hiring. Grew it to 2000+ folks over 6 months. We did an event every 3 weeks - tech talk on a solved problem, hackathon or yearly global day of code retreat (a worldwide event we registered and  hosted along 100s of other companies). 

Ops - Usually hosted by our architect, CTO from a partner company or insightful guest speakers from previous meets for lightning talks. Initially didn‚Äôt stream the event to make it feel exclusive. Started streaming on Twitter & YouTube when crowd started hitting capacity. 2 hrs max (except code retreat was 6 hrs)

Deets - Completely free, all registrations on meetup site or Google form, pizzas for lunch at closure. Budget would be 5-8k per event. On avg 60-80% would turn up. First 3-4 ones we only got about 10 folks to come. Eventually 6 months down the line, 50+ would come which was our limit as we had a small office.

Hiring - I made 3 SSE hires from these events + 1 architect on consultant contract.

Hello everyone, 
Working on setting up BGV process. Was looking for some inputs: 

1. What platform do you use for BGV? 
2. Do y'all undertake BGV for all incoming hires or only a subset of them. If it's the latter, then on what basis is the subset chosen (is it role/dept/hierarchy-wise or some other additional parameters are considered)?
3. Do y'all undertake a standard one-piece-fits-all approach for all hires where BGV is done or do y'all verify different parameters based on the role/person being hired
4. What type of BGV checks have yall opted for and what was the rationale for it
5. Do the documents need to be submitted/uploaded by the HR, or does the platform ask for documents from the candidate? Did you have a choice of choosing between the two? <This message was edited>

1.‚Å† ‚Å†What platform do you use for BGV? _SpringVerify_
2.‚Å† ‚Å†Do y'all undertake BGV for all incoming hires or only a subset of them. If it's the latter, then on what basis is the subset chosen (is it role/dept/hierarchy-wise or some other additional parameters are considered)? _All full-time hires_
3.‚Å† ‚Å†Do y'all undertake a standard one-piece-fits-all approach for all hires where BGV is done or do y'all verify different parameters based on the role/person being hired. _We have a one-size-fits-all approach. It can be customised for exec hires if needed_
4.‚Å† ‚Å†What type of BGV checks have yall opted for and what was the rationale for it _Identity, court checks (includes address check too), employment checks (last 2 employers, no reference check), education check (highest degree). Rationale was that these checks suffice the elements we would want to check for any hires, and does not cause any legal implications later. For specific cases, we can include a ref check if necessary - eg. exec hires._
5.‚Å† ‚Å†Do the documents need to be submitted/uploaded by the HR, or does the platform ask for documents from the candidate? Did you have a choice of choosing between the two? _Yes, there is a choice, and we ask the candidates to upload it._

sender: Kshitij Gupta Lead TA Global Pixis. Ai
message: Depends on role but for example we have 3-4 rounds of interviews. R1 is Exploratory call to do basic checks and mutual alignment of skills by one of the interviewer, then R2 Technical round to check Depth of mandatory skills then R3 covers Breadth of overall skills, and final round is cultural fitment or HMs discussion. Now ideally for every 5 candidates who reach Final round 1 should get offer. In worst case 7 anything above that the interview process should be reviewed if assessment is correct. Now for every 5 candidates to reach HM round atleast 7-10 go through Technical rounds. And for those 7-10 technical rounds atleast 12-15 screened and Shortlisted candidates to be lined up. And to get those 12-15 shortlisted candidates you may need to source 20-30 candidates, screen and shortlist top candidates meeting the criteria. Now it may happen that role gets closed in first 3 candidates you line up or in some cases when expectations are high from HMs it can take months to close as well. Good to backtrack and see what usually works for each skills, candidate pool size,  demographics, Quarter in which hiring request are made (Example Candidates are less likely to switch close to appraisals in quarter 4 hence even if people take offers there is high chances they use it to their benefits and negotiate internally) and many other variables. So there is no one size fits all answer to this.

I have dirtied my hands with Dev hiring for product company. Say even if 100 assignment is shared out 500 , 50% submit assignment... 50 % assignments gets shortlisted.....so that's where the interviews will start

This is a journey in my view and as recruiters at heart,  this ratio will  keep varying and we will keep working towards it üëçI waz lucky enough to have enjoyed good offer to joining ratios. <This message was edited>
I can resonate üòä
try out our quickscreen assessments. we have 80% completion rate :)
Our hiring managers prefer to design their own assignments which resonates with the work they will be doing. So for us it was more than number of completions, who completes it.

so if someone has taken time to complete the assignment, and is shortlisted, probability of he clearing our tech panel is high. So our focus was on right people in our radar to complete the assignment.
We also used Hackerrank for some roles.

so there are pros and cons of both approaches. depends on at what time you want what.

If you are sending a 2-3 days or even a 6-8 hrs project assignment, nothing is a replacement for that. they are best. But if you are sending a 1-2 hr take home assignment, I have seen that the more crispier the assignment is, it's better since you are able to keep them engaged and the final shortlisting is almost same.

Yes, it depends on what the desired output is. For some we have asked them to share Code and if good grilled them on their code source also. Time of submission was chosen by candidates similar to the way they estimate. This was one of the observations in our selection process, how they estimated, were they able to complete within that timeline if not how did they handle us...etc etc <This message was edited>

Recently, I spoke with a candidate who had a gap in his resume. When I asked about the reasons, he told me how he spent that time traveling and volunteering globally. He went on to explain how this experience gave him an exceptional adaptability and cultural sensitivity, qualities that are invaluable in our increasingly global workplace.

I jst read thia on LinkedIn.. N may be helpful for u..

It may be tough to get back after a break.
But I think u need to focus on positives, how it has helped u as a person.. What all have u done to keep u updated on trends / industry connects etc..

I have had candidates who have taken a break for 6 months or more due to medical conditions, I just ensure they are healthy to come back to work. While some have due to family reasons take a break, life happens and judging someone based on that is wrong. 

Like Mitch said you will have to focus on the positives.

I had a family member who went through this in covid, the company had taken back their offer and then it took the person a year to find the next role but we kept the person motivated and encouraged to do what they liked, finally got a role they wanted and we choose the path of honesty that helped

Hi Shweta,

Thanks for sharing. 
I think it's better to keep it simple and say that you were not keeping well and went to stay with your family.

Also, if something is suitable to your profile, go ahead and take that job at a lesser pay, work for 1.5 years and make up for the career gap professionally. You can bargain a higher pay while you're in the job while looking for other opportunities. 

You could compromise on money, a bit for a while, but do not compromise on the role. 

I say this because it is true that distance MBA candidates are less preferred in the job market, unfortunately, so once you land something focus on performance and upskilling. 

I will also say one year gap is nothing, we have returning mothers I have hired in my office after 3-4 years of maternity break and they are thriving.

Patience is going to be key.
And like other community members have said earlier - make a list of things that you learned in your gap year (without sounding too philosophical) and talk about them in the interview. 

Also, DM me your resum√©, let me see if I can refer. Thanks.

There‚Äôs a noticeable trend where HR professionals often connect and engage with their network specially on LinkedIn, mainly when they are seeking new job opportunities or hiring for a particular role, and hide their profiles or limitating the connection requests by allowing only people who have their email IDs or in their contact list to connect, once they secure employment. This approach can limit the potential for building sustained, meaningful professional relationships and networking that can be beneficial in the long term, both for career growth and for fostering a supportive HR community.
Lots of HRs put ‚Äúhiring‚Äù in their profile but are never active on LinkedIn or respond to applications.

sender: GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto
message: Also, my point is different "The fact is that the recruiter who is posting about his/her candidate joining increases their chances to be targeted for their next role" üòâ
Valid point !
Recruiter is trying to do some branding + enhancing reach of his linkedin.

Adding on top of what everyone has mentioned, some candidates don't update their LinkedIn in the initial days of joining a new org, if they are looking out. 

If the recruiter/org proactively posts about their new joiners and tags them, it's all over their feed and lesser chances of candidates leaving soon after joining.
I think that‚Äôs the best way to look at it!!
As far as I know, they don't care of these !
It can create some pressure but at d end of the day if they feel they badly need to change, anyway they will

This is definitely one of the best things to consider. 

I had similar encounters with 3 of our new employees on different occasions. 

When asked to update their LinkedIn profiles. 3 new employees have hesitated. 

2 of them left within 2 weeks - 1 month & the other candidate failed in their Background Verification. 

So the guess / suspicion was right at the beginning when they‚Äôve hesitated to update their LinkedIn profiles. <This message was edited>

Hi Folks, could someone help me understand how many rounds are typically involved in hiring software architect or lead engineer roles?
4-5 rounds
Initial assignment/ quick test, Recruiter screening, assignment, assignment review discussion, culture = 5 <This message was edited>

Initial round can be basic screening ,

Second can be coding 

3rd design round HLD ( here we can have two ways give a task to design HLD and LLD and after that we can have assignment discussion )

4 Manager discussion 

Final HR discussion 

This is for leads or architect

+1 to it. 

For leads / architects, I honestly don't recommend assignment/quick test. 

Instead a Bar-raiser round can be kept after/before managerial round, which can go deep dive into coding and system design. The Bar raiser is taken by someone very senior (who is purely into tech) like principal engineer, or staff engineer, or DoE (who is a hands on person)

Hello everyone 
Just a periodic reminder of the community guidelines.
Guidelines for Recruitment Route are as follows

1. Be professional
2. Treat others online as you would treat them in real life
3. Be tolerant towards others‚Äô viewpoints; respectfully disagree when opinions do not align
4. Respect the privacy and personal information of other community members
5. Communicate with courtesy and respect

6. Avoid using the group for DMs - If there‚Äôs a topic that only concerns you and one other person, please DM them about it.
7. Strictly NO BUSINESS or EVENT PROMOTIONS allowed in the community without the ADMIN'S EXPRESS APPROVAL
8. Strictly NO SPAM
9. Please keep your posts in any group on-topic

10. DO NOT share any member‚Äôs contact details with a 3rd party without their express consent
11. Do not DM other members for sales purposes without their permission, unless you have a pre-existing relationship with them

12. The other community groups in this community are as follows:
- Jobs Board: Group for you to post job openings as well as CVs for referrals.
- Chit-Chat: Our chill space where we can discuss anything under the sun
13. Do give us a follow on LinkedIn and feel free to flaunt your membership by adding it under your experience section: https://www.linkedin.com/company/recruitment-route/
14. Most Importantly: HAVE FUN!
One more thing. We have a members directory page: https://dhvo.short.gy/RRMembership
This is for the community members to be aware of who their fellow members are

Can someone tell me the statutory bonus clause on the eligibility? Is it mandatory for someone whose basic salary is less than or equal to 21k?

The statutory bonus eligibility criteria are as follows 
- Employees earning up to Rs. 21,000 per month are eligible for the statutory bonus.
- The employee must have worked for at least 30 days in the accounting year.
- The Payment of Bonus Act applies to factories and establishments with 20 or more employees.
- Startups and new establishments are exempt from paying the statutory bonus for the first five years.

To improve your organization's Glassdoor reviews, consider the following strategies:

1. Encourage employees to share their positive experiences on Glassdoor.
2. Respond promptly and professionally to both positive and negative reviews.

sender: GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto
message:
My Few pointers for improving Glassdoor rating

-	Get your leaders on board to read reviews and fix common problems in the culture; otherwise, your efforts won't matter.
-	Flag negative Glassdoor reviews with valid reasons; about 20% don't meet Glassdoor standards and can be removed.
-	Wait a week for Glassdoor to remove invalid negative reviews, then respond politely to show you care about addressing concerns.
-	Motivate your satisfied employees to leave 5-star reviews on Glassdoor to boost your ratings.
-	Share employee activities and reward pictures on Glassdoor regularly to engage your audience. 
-	Make your workplace happier with fair pay, good benefits, a friendly atmosphere, and opportunities for growth.
-	Simplify the interview and feedback process to ensure a positive candidate experience.
-	Always keep an eye on your Glassdoor ratings and adjust your efforts based on feedback.

Keep in mind, that the key is to make your employees happy, which often results in better ratings.
This sounds good
Thankyou this helps

Hi Basant,

In general of course, you can encourage hiring managers to assess the current diversity ratio of their teams and if they have the choice between candidates of similar calibre then fill the position to ensure diversity. 

Proactive way to do this is to run a selective *Leadership Program* to strengthen your current staff and ensure women/ diverse groups get representation as decision makers. Parallel to this, you can run a diversity/ women *Allyship Program* to train the managers of the selected group to also encourage and allow more autonomy among diverse groups and nurture their growth. This would be like a mirror program to the leadership one. 

Diversity is not necessarily having representation across various groups, it is also that no matter your background, your skill set is all that matters. This is a generic training that everyone could do as a part of onboarding checklist.
PT is state but rest is central

Fascinating how the media and a few LinkedIn influencers are fear mongering.

What are the local unions asking for? 
Implementation of Sarojini Mahishi report of 1989 which suggested reservation in Group C and D jobs in Government and Private sectors.

What is Group C and D?

Group C - Operations, Field work and clerical jobs
Group D - Peons, Gatekeepers, sweepers and semi skilled labours

Why is this demand being made?
The argument is that a majority of Private firms acquired land in the state after converting it from an agricultural plot, this is an opportunity cost for the locals. Hence the move is to balance out the situation.


I hope you'll make your own conclusions based on the above naunces. Also, there is a chance that the courts will strike the bill down and state Congress blames opposition for the stunt.

sender: Samar Banu Sr. HR Specialist Betsol
message: Thanks Clive! Did Scrut held up to your expectations in implementations?

It's the same as insurance TPAs. The newer providers are trying to create a platform experience but when it comes to grass roots, the older players are really strong with their subject. From getting discounts, to including lives even though they were not insured on time. They are able to influence decision makers. However slowly the newer players are starting to find their grounding..
Honestly none do for me üòÇ.. I've realised you need to know what you want. Research & ask them questions & also push them to include whatever you want/need
Even with a big 4. They will give you templates that are completely outdated. Same with the smaller players. This was my overall experience even through demos.
So before you decide. Ask them to provide you a framework of what they would do. What they need from you. Do you own research. Get things in place etc...

sender: Ipshita Ray HR Ops Specialist Tricog
message: What is garden leave?

Garden leave is a transition period for employees who give or are given notice of termination, keeping them on the payroll but away from the workplace. Under the leave, employees are prohibited from working for the competition or themselves.

It‚Äôs a matter of concern I believe for everyone of us.

What I usually prefer is those candidates who are immediate joiners are given first priority.

sender: Vaibhav Dalal Sr. Director HR nference
message: Very common problem even with referrals (friends of my employees). Part of me wants to put their name on linkedin and shame them cause they have been dishonest. Nothing you can do. Like Shruti said, prioritise early joiners, no candidates with 90days notice.

There is other side of the story too where candidates are ghosted. Recruiters promise interviews and then simoly stop receiving the messages and calls of people. Candidates call from other numbers to know that someone else who have applied earlier are being considered or the position is no more relevant because the requirement have changed.
Overall recruitment is very much broken.
So basically no solution
90 days we don‚Äôt give , but they are refusing 60 days also
it‚Äôs just become such a nuisance now
Referrals also don‚Äôt work
I agree
Neha - Tap resources from consultancy they might have few resources available on immediate basis ! I know one vendor if you need I can share Contact .

The best medicine to control renege is to tap quality resources and ensure we do triple layered check before releasing offer . 
Ideally for one position we need keep one or two more selections as a buffer . This will help to certain extent to control the damage .
Also Enable pofu process ..

sender: Suma Gururaj Sr. Manager TA LendingKart
message: To identify quality resources and to tap passive candidates ( hoping decline chances are less) it takes time and business always puts these positions as P0.

When we present only immediate joiners or candidates with gaps of 3 months to a year, some hiring stakeholders refuse to interview them. They often say that I'm always providing these types of profiles, rushing to close the role. However, some stakeholders are happy to accept them. This is a day-to-day challenge we face until the candidate actually checks in at the office.

sender: GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto
message: Hello Neha, I have extensively worked on this and have been quite successful. Happy to help

Hi Neha,

I guess the challenge is there in both immediate joiner and 30 days notice period,both sides of people will make the best of the situation by taking a counter offers.
What personally have helped me getting that trust from candidate in first call by pitching transparently,if candidate is from same city get them for f2f atleast for last few rounds more effective that virtual. <This message was edited>

Company where i waz heading people function waz runnning both services and product verticals , both in different tech stack. We had rolled out offers to people with 90 days NP. There were hardly any dropouts! It all  starts from how passionately we as recruiters position the opportunity that matches with their career aspirations and yes having a good buffer plan. 

Immediate joinerz and quality is not always matching...so building a strong talent pipeline is crucial. 

I also openly told people to inform me if their mind changes as we depend on them and practically need time to search again. People have informed as well in couple of tumes.

So its about having multiple ways to ensure talent availability to business, which suits your geography, culture , role and growth opportunities. <This message was edited>
+ having backup candidates until the offered person walks through the office doors on DOJ is heavily underrated
This really depends if the company can afford back ups in the worst case if everyone joins <This message was edited>

Absolutely. We were hiring tech leads for our product vertical and we had 3 final selections.  We still might fail here as we have rolled out offer only to one. If he doesn't join and the other 2 are not available, we again reach to 0. So if budgets and team structures permit, roll out for 2, also have identify internal potential candidate pipeline and build them
Yes budget and appetite if you hv an additional joiner

Thank you
Here we have the refusal
To accept higher notice period let alone offering them
Rest have been following still at 60% offer to join
And Hiring manager should also plan for dropout scenario impact on projects and how to mitigate it <This message was edited>

While they might be a core employee, when you state that you are trying to protect you IT & other confidential data, how much of this data is present with the employee? Ideally I'm guessing everything is created on official company assets & not on any employees personal drive. If you have the right security protocols, you data should remain intact. 

Coming to confidential data, many times what we presume is confidential is not considered the same in the court of law. 

It's actually near to impossible for someone to replicate exactly what another org is doing, coz every founder wants a differentiated offering. And growth of revenue is not only due to your product but also the actual service output.

sender: Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge
message:
Good morning everyone,
I am approaching this experienced cohort with a challenge Iam facing. 
Ours is a 10 years old start up company. Till last year we had unlimited leave policy, which means there was no cap on max number of day of leave and likewise we did not have leave encashment or leave carry forward.

As we are now scaling and we have around 250 employees, our founders decided to implement a cap on leave and introduced a new policy with around 24 days leave including  casual leave and sick leave. As a result, people started asking about leave encashment and leave carry forward. 
Though we have a HRMS where people are supposed to apply for leave to ensure we have a record of leave taken by each employee, the culture is yet to grow and managers are not enforcing application of leave before proceeding on leave. Further, as we have flexible working hours and compensatory offs we dont intend to allow leave encashment or carry forward.

My queries to you all:
1.‚Å† ‚Å†Is it mandatory by any law to have leave encashment or leave carry carry forward or is it a company policy matter?
2.‚Å† ‚Å†If I revert back to unlimited leave policy and if an employee resigns , is he entitled to leave encashment? 

Looking forward to your advice folks
Regards and thanks in advanceüôè

Dear Chinmaya. Happy Sunday üåû

Please refer to the below link for everything about Leave Encashments. May be of some help to you.

https://www.zoho.com/in/payroll/academy/payroll-administration/leave-encashment.html#:~:text=Leave%20encashment%20refers%20to%20the,forward%20to%20the%20next%20year.
Good morning Chinmaya. Leave encashment is not mandatory. It is a firms decision if they want to provide this benefit or not.

If you understand leave policies according to labour law, emoyees earn 1 leave after they work for 20 days. This Earned leave is employees right. If they dont take it, it has to be enclashed. Now how much is encashed, how much is carry forwarded, when do you want them to encash ( annualy or at exit ) is dependent on the policy you make. Sick leaves are not carry forwarded or encashed. <This message was edited>

sender: Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge
message: Thank you folks. Really helpful.üôè

Hey Harika 
As per shop act Leave encashment of upto 45 is mandatory <This message was edited>

On what stage you want to do leave encashment is upto the org
They can choose to do it end of each year or during f&f settlement when the staff is leaving

sender: Shweta Govila HR Manager Abhi Loans
message: Also, encashment is done on the basis of basic of salary
Hey Krishna this varies per state right? How do orgs in different states handle this? I was told by a legal counsel that in case of unlimited leaves this doesn't apply.
What labour courts / shops & establishment act of each state is that employees are getting their minimum. Maximum is as per each company policies.

Leave encampment will still be there with a capping as per shop act 
Each states shop act mentions it in the act

This again has contesting 
As per a new ammendment it is to be done on gross and not basic but orgs still continue to choose gray are in this

That‚Äôs right 
Like for Maharashtra and Karnataka cap of 45 is given for encashment similar for each states
Can you send the link to read on thiz amendment
Leme see if can find it
<Media omitted>
This is for the 45 days clause and full wages that we were discussing <This message was edited>

sender: Tejaswi Vajinepalli Asst. Manager HRBP LEAD
message: This 45 days is not for an year. That's the max cap that is according to the law. In general, companies allow around 10 days of earned leaves for every year carry forward for accumulation. Max Cap is mostly limited to 40 days in many companies.

Correct 
It‚Äôs the max capping military vetoing which it will collaps
Again max capping is purely on the shop act they fall under that states the capping limit for the lifetime of the employee journey
Encashed as per basic pay. That is also by law. Basic is generally 40% of the fixed. So it isn't quite rewarding
My 2 orgs it was given on gross
That can be a progressive choice or a negligence or a lack of awareness. Doesn't happen in Big 4 and below as of now as per my knowledge
Very rare case <This message was edited>

Out of the 5 Iv worked 
2 did gross 
2 did basic 
And 1 did nothing :) dispite law asking them to

How much should be the avg cost of payroll for a 30 to 35 cr arr org ?
When we were making 5M$ our head count was about 70 (Engineering + manufacturing + production) our payroll cost was less than 1cr
Today our ARR is 20M$ and head count is about 220 and monthly payroll cost is less than 3cr
You folks are saying yearly payroll right ? <This message was edited>
I assume it is monthly
For a 50 people team we had touched 60L/ month
Ideal range is 25-30% but it can be much higher for services organisations or labor intense, such as delivery etc..
Engineeringvand Sales teams constitutes the major %
And again this all depends on what you are building, hire fast you want it out in the market etc. Accordingly, you will decide to over index
Monthly payroll cost
Also which exact functions comprise your headcount
So for 30-35 cr ARR, payroll can hover anywhere between 20-50% depending on the functions that comprise your headcount.
Any one from this group has US Hiring experience ?
Iv seen a range of 20 to 70 so was just taking pulse on what folks have witnessed

And majorly saw a trend that layoff chances where high with higher payroll cost, it‚Äôs more to do with numbers than the head count in my experience basis the info I am collecting and data I have seen

sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message: Let me share what I did, Mridusha. I was a CS grad and a dev/analytics person for 3 years before realising I am interested in HR. I did Ops, BP, Recruiting, EB for 4 years in a way I made for myself - imperfect but from the ground up. And then I realised I am going to hit a wall soon so I did a 1.5yr course from TISS - they call it SVE  program (school of vocational education: https://sve.tiss.edu/TISS/) and seems it has been rebranded now to something else. But my 2019 course was classroom in gurgaon with coursework and faculty from TISS visiting each weekend (that centre is now closed). This course was eye opening because I was studying with leaders who had handled strikes in manufacturing or handled 10k+ span in mother dairy or something similar. I learnt a lot from people and coursework here, and it helped me a lot in my program work at Unacademy in thinking and executing broadly.

sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message: Last year, I realised I need to think more strategically and know more about demonstrating value to CSuite folks, so I did a 6-month certificate course from NUS held online (https://executive-education.nus.edu.sg/programmes/global-hr-leaders-program-hrlp/) where 40 people crowd was from 12 different countries and gave me a very rich understanding of cross border issues that HR leaders need to handle for CXOs. Many of those issues I had not even envisioned. Half faculty was NUS faculty and other half were CHROs from HP, Schindler etc. I actually got more from this than my TISS course. I also paid 3x for this than my TISS üòÇ but it was definitely worth it for me in the long run. Alumni network in both cases is strong.

Hello folks,

Offer cannot be revoked once the person has joined the company
Also he has resigned formally (I hope) hence termination of employment is also not advisable
U need to accept the resignation, clear dues if any and give him employment letter
Has the appointment letter been issued?

Yes

Then don't pay anything and forget them. For real.

This happens a lot when you hire for sales.

1. Bench period: Employees can typically stay on the bench for [90] days before any action is considered.

sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message:
Sharpen one's own design sense first:
1. Train yourself atleast 2-3 times with https://cantunsee.space/
2. Do 2-3 live sourcing with your designer HM for 30 mins each, once a week. note what doesn't work for him/her.
3. Resumes matter less for designers, portfolios are king. But a poorly designed resume should be a reject (too many colours, strange fonts, incorrect typefacing, etc)
If the portfolio already has examples of the assignment you want to give them, skip it. If they worked in a company before which solved the problem the assignment covers, skip it. Go directly to scheduling them with HM and then subsequent rounds (be especially attentive in rounds with product managers)

sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message: ask to shadow 1-2 rounds with each stakeholder (but mostly final round person won't be comfortable with this). but most design folks will be happy to include you that you want to be so involved and understand their craft <This message was edited>

sender: Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit
message:
Hi Guys, 

I just wanted to understand that while doing reference checks in India for a very Senior Role, do we initiate an email, call the references, or a mixture of both if needed?
An email is the best way, if there is no response, then a call is warranted

sender: Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit
message: Wanted to understand, why are calls not the preferred mode? Since, it can give us a better understanding.

This is a for a very senior role and referrees will also be senior, they wouldn't appreciate a cold call. A connect from the candidate will help, else an email followed by a call is the right approach <This message was edited>

sender: Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit
message: Hm, thought the same. Thanks alot for the help.

sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message: Yes, send a mail asking for a time to speak or informing them you‚Äôll call at so-and-so time and do the check on call. They‚Äôre not going to write to you, they‚Äôre ultra busy people. Do the call post 8/9 pm for very senior folks, that‚Äôs when they‚Äôre actually free

sender: Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit
message: Noted. I think a call might be a bit weird considering we are hiring a director and the references will also be somewhat at the same position.

sender: Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit
message: Not sure, if HR's out their do call.

Is this a reference that was provided by the candidate or is this a blind ref check. 

For blind - you should get someone you know to introduce you to the reference. 

For non-blind reference;
Send an email to the reference to seek a date & time that works for a call while also seeking confirmation that they are ok with a call.

sender: Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit
message: Non-blind reference.
So its a peer reference. That's fine as long as you are aligning on the context of what you seek from that reference..

sender: Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit

A good read 
The typical notice period for tech jobs varies significantly between the US and Europe. In the US, it's common for employees to provide 2-3 weeks of notice, sometimes up to 4 weeks, as a courtesy. This period isn't typically mandated by law, and employees can technically leave their job at any time ¬π.

In contrast, European employment contracts often require a much longer notice period, typically 3 months or more. This extended period is designed to provide employers with sufficient time to find a replacement and ensure a smoother transition. However, it can also limit labor mobility and impact wages ¬π.

It's worth noting that notice periods can vary across European countries. For example, Germany has longer notice periods, while Greece has shorter periods, sometimes as short as 2 weeks ¬π. France also has a relatively standard notice period of 30 days, with employees required to pay the employer for each missing day if they fail to provide adequate notice ¬π.

*Notice Periods in European Countries:*

- _Germany_: Longer notice periods
- _Greece_: Shorter notice periods (as short as 2 weeks)
- _France_: 30 days

Overall, understanding the typical notice periods in the US and Europe can help you navigate the job market and plan your next career move.

sender: Anjali Sathya TA Manager CADeploy Engineering
message:
Shopping around the offers mostly we face it with active job seekers compared to passive ones is what I observed in my recruiting experience 

Coz the passive seekers will seek to gather more information during the screening call and let us know at first if they don't want to continue further wherein for active the first priority is on who pays highest and better benefits and infrastructure rather than focusing on career path and as we know mostly these are the ones who again switches the jobs in less than a year

sender: Anjali Sathya TA Manager CADeploy Engineering
message:
But then we have to be very careful while probing to active seekers, why are they looking out for change (is it role change? Financial?  Circumstances? Etc.,) this way we can have better understanding on the candidates. I have seen many juniors who just explain role, and schedule the interview call rather than understanding of the candidates (the call duration max ends in 5 mins) later coming back n saying candidates has dropped and he got better opportunity why not ours companies is best option to him? 

Understanding the role and candidates, plays a major role here to build a good relationship which helps to bring the best and aligning the right fit in job role
This is where hand picking right recruiters becomes all the more critical, n continuous monitoring and coaching would create the right impact...
Well the core team that i hired has atleast 5 yrs tenure

Don't take me wrong, it is all about the quality of recruiter n not just number of years of experience, I had faced pit falls thinking  higher the experience levels the quality of recruiter is better, no, only comp increased n quality came down...

sender: Anjali Sathya TA Manager CADeploy Engineering
message:
Exactly, I had a experience recently with one of the recruiters who is hiring for Lloyds..

Unfortunately I couldn't carry my cv hard copy as I was attending interview in other 2 companies and went directly to this but then before four days shared my updated Cv with her. When they asked I requested for the print out they had escalated saying the first impression is best one, we would understand it for technical people and helps them with printout but you being into recruitment why you didn't carry yours...and you failed in it by not carrying your resume for the interviews. 


In my mind what is meant by first impression?  Why only helping to tech folks and not to non tech? The interview scheduled at 2 pm and recruiter came to collect at 3:30 pm for the resume did the company not failed?  Recruiter not failed here? 

The answer from the recruiter side we are busy with lots of work n meetings.  Then why did you even schedule the interview call should have done your work... 

I understand everyone is busy and ad-hoc will be but why are justifying at one and not the other side mainly here the understanding failed

sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message: mention role + exp/level, you'll get answers. the ask is too generic for the answers to be helpful to you

In startups especially if its Bootstrapped, cashflow visibility is the first factor, and then the critical competencies, Niche skills that needs to be retained comes up. U can then see the market data, can u match, cant match, if u cant match , think of ways to innovate ur comp structure etc etc

If you have PMS system sets
 in, it gives you the data on performanceüëç <This message was edited>
Adaptive compensation strategies are crucial for retaining niche skills

sender: Jeevitha Mohan Sr. Exec HR Mirrar
message:
It's kind of mixed , there are tech people, sales , Hr and the salary range differs for everyone. Few are on lesser package side and few on higher range.

We thought of giving it on bases of their rating percentage for instance if we rated someone 4 so their percentage will be 10 but here is the problem, people with High package and receiving 10% makes sense but people on a lower side 10% will be very less to them. 
So wanted to understand how to go about this ?

sender: Nataraja Nanjundaiah Credit Audit Payroll Expert
message: it is an allignment between how u want to compete with your indusrty competitor in your sector. and the talent and ability brought by the employee‚Ä¶. so if the person is skilled and might negotiate outside then u should look for offering hike accordinngly to retain. Also there are other retention strategies including esops and company culture matters

sender: Nataraja Nanjundaiah Credit Audit Payroll Expert
message: u should devise the performance scorecard taking all parameters both subjective and objective, it is a detailed exercise which has to be done and make sure everyone understands. though u will still have someone challenging but it is continous improvement exercise

In this case what you can do is have a benchmarking for the role of the employees and make a correction and top it give the percentage 

This way you are making sure employees are rightly paid

As per my knowledge here is the data points :: 
1. Early-stage startups (0-5 years): 10-20% annual hike
2. Growth-stage startups (5-10 years): 15-25% annual hike
3. Established startups (10+ years): 20-30% annual hike

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî OR 

Avg performer - 4 to 6%
Good performer - 10 to 15%
Outstanding performer - 25 to 30% 

I am not sure for specific to technology / industry .
Also it depends on what budget we hired initially , budgets for this role, if the person grew beyond the role, etc etc finally.....
There is no direct formula that works for startups. Given the current market scenario, it might be also for certain roles

This is your friendly regular reminder of the community guidelines

1. Be professional
2. Treat others online as you would treat them in real life
3. Be tolerant towards others‚Äô viewpoints; respectfully disagree when opinions do not align
4. Respect the privacy and personal information of other community members
5. Communicate with courtesy and respect

6. Avoid using the group for DMs - If there‚Äôs a topic that only concerns you and one other person, please DM them about it.
7. Strictly NO BUSINESS or EVENT PROMOTIONS allowed in the community without the ADMIN'S EXPRESS APPROVAL
8. Strictly NO SPAM
9. Please keep your posts in any group on-topic

10. DO NOT share any member‚Äôs contact details with a 3rd party without their express consent
11. Do not DM other members for sales purposes without their permission, unless you have a pre-existing relationship with them

12. The other community groups in this community are as follows:
- Jobs Board: Group for you to post job openings as well as CVs for referrals.

Hi all, can anyone share their referral policy please üôè

1. If the candidate has applied directly then the profile can be considered as a referral only after 6 months
2. If two people are referring the candidate, whoever is referred first will be considered as the primary referral or the candidate has to confirm on the primary referer
3. For payout, the referrer and the referred candidate both have to be active employe at the time of payout (should not be serving notice)
4. Out of 30k of referral bonus, 5k is paid after completing 1st month and balance 25k after completing total 3 months with the company

sender: Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge
message:
Good morning Folks, 
As a 10 years old B2B SaaS start up with about 250 people, we have migrated from unlimited leave to a capped leave system. We want to align with other orgs in similar phase, size or age in crafting our leave policy.

I am compiling a Google sheet for data points on leaves by various orgs.

Could you please share data for the orgs you have worked or you are aware of in the following manner:
1. Name of org:
2. Size (No. Of employees):
3. Age(Years since raising)
4. Types and Number of days of leave offered.
5. Leave encashment allowed (Y/N) and how many days:

Thank you all üôåüôèü´°

Few things you may want to consider while designing leaves are:
- Do you want it to be shops and establishment act compliant? If you have offices in different states then design it according to that state.
- Look at funding/cash flow situation of your company which actually decides paid leaves apart from what has to be given minimum. Will this cost be ok for company even it scales to more employees? 
- Avg age groups of the employees as the needs might differ
- Should be simple and easy on admin mgmt
- Last but not the least employees should feel it a useful one <This message was edited>

sender: Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge
message:
Thank you Kumuda.
Till now we were not compliant with  S and E Act.  But I feel, as we scale and grow in size, it is safer to be compliant. 
Average age is 23-25 yrs. <This message was edited>

Hi everyone 
External events and business promotions must be run by admin before posting in the community
I'm resharing the community guidelines. Request all of you to please save these and go through them in detail

1. Be professional
2. Treat others online as you would treat them in real life
3. Be tolerant towards others‚Äô viewpoints; respectfully disagree when opinions do not align
4. Respect the privacy and personal information of other community members
5. Communicate with courtesy and respect

6. Avoid using the group for DMs - If there‚Äôs a topic that only concerns you and one other person, please DM them about it.
7. Strictly NO BUSINESS or EVENT PROMOTIONS allowed in the community without the ADMIN'S EXPRESS APPROVAL
8. Strictly NO SPAM
9. Please keep your posts in any group on-topic

10. DO NOT share any member‚Äôs contact details with a 3rd party without their express consent
11. Do not DM other members for sales purposes without their permission, unless you have a pre-existing relationship with them

12. The other community groups in this community are as follows:
- Jobs Board: Group for you to post job openings as well as CVs for referrals.
- Chit-Chat: Our chill space where we can discuss anything under the sun
13. Do give us a follow on LinkedIn and feel free to flaunt your membership by adding it under your experience section: https://www.linkedin.com/company/recruitment-route/
14. Most Importantly: HAVE FUN!
Please note that posts in violation will be deleted without any intimation

sender: Sunit Desai Sr. Manager People Experience CashFlo
message:
Normally I try doing proactive pipeline building in two scenarios:
1). *When the recruitment is little slow*, then I take up mapping projects, by figuring out which departments might need talent in future, or which departments regularly need talent after specific intervals. By doing this, it will save your time in search, when an actual requirement comes up, you will just to connect with the talent pool.
2). *When I make an offer to a candidate*, I have a devised a scoring system which has multiple factors in it personal & professional, which help me determine a percentage score of the candidate‚Äôs joining probabilty. Based on the joining percentage I get an idea if I need to actively keep on searching for backups on not. If the joining percentage seems low, then I proactively keep on building a backup pipeline, by doing 1st round of interviews with backups and keeping them warm.

Hi All,

I'd like to hear your thoughts on offering leave during probation.

Currently, we don't have any defined leave policy for probation periods. Employees can take leave in case of an emergency, but it would be considered as Leave Without Pay (LOP).

Before considering any revisions to the policy, I wanted to understand how other companies are handling this.
Our company offers 2 consecutive days of leaves during probation. These are paid leaves.
1 paid leave during probation period . After completion of probation it‚Äôs 1.25 paid leave added by month on month .

sender: Ipshita Ray HR Ops Specialist Tricog
message:
We have 3 months probation, we offer them 1 leave per month for the 3 months. If they finish their 3 leaves then the leaves taken after that will be LOP. 

Once confirmed they have earned leaves that is 1.5 leaves every 20th of the month for 12 months. This way they utilize their leaves plus ofcourse we have the casual and sick leave

What if it fails? So its better to do during offer stage or earlier to it. Some companies do basic bgv like identify before the interviews start. So it differs from org to org

There is a clause to terminate employment if an employee fails their BGV. People's have even been let go years later. Once something comes to light that is untrue, an employer still has the right to terminate employment..
Many service companies who have BFSI clients may undertake a BGV before they can allocate an employee to a clients server, as per a mandate from that client. Examples are - Citi, JPMC, UBS etc..

sender: Komal Patil HR Ops Specialist Companystore.io
message: I had seen this method being used in my husband‚Äôs office so implemented in my office as well. It‚Äôs really good methodology if you are hiring for a experienced person

I have used it as a part of BEI interviewing round. Basis is past behaviour is the best indicator of future performance.
Pros: Structured answers, reduces ambiguity and assumptions. Objective evaluation.
Cons: Works best for experienced folks. Doesn't really add value in case of freshers/ junior folks who do not really have a lot of experience to share.
In today's information world, challenge is how to identify preparedness and potential of the person to predict the future performance

sender: Shivaraju K P TA Manager OppDoor
message: Conducting a recruitment drive specifically for women candidates with career breaks could be a good option to consider.

I try to have a balance at all interview stages (50-50) and when I do an active outreach, focus solely on sourcing female candidates. 

Also, set realistic goals with your hiring teams. Eg. 50-50 in Engineering is not possible because your college ratios are at 35-405 females.
When it comes to diversity, we stop at gender diversity and women with career break. Why can't this be also for men and other genders? ü§î and also add other diversity factors beyond gender...
Tapping into Women only talent pool by collaborating with companies like HerKey can be a good option.
I didn't have a great outcome from HerKey

Hi Everyone,

I wanted to gather some insights on an industry-specific query. What is the standard practice followed when an employee joins an organization but leaves immediately within 2-3 days (usually citing reasons like receiving a better offer or being in the final stages of another interview process before joining)?

Specifically, I‚Äôm curious to know:

Are such cases considered as formal employment and recorded in the system?
Is there a probationary clause that comes into play in such situations?
What are the common practices regarding salary payouts, documentation, and relieving formalities?


It would be great to hear your thoughts or learn about how your organization approaches this scenario. Looking forward to your input!

sender: Shivaraju K P TA Manager OppDoor
message:
If the employee has not been formally onboarded, you can revoke the offer and close the case.

If onboarding is complete and the employee's details are recorded, termination clauses can be applied for immediate exit without salary, provided they violated the agreement. However, if the employee worked even briefly and raises a labor dispute, it could become an issue.

The best approach is to discuss and resolve the matter amicably with employee as this will be an issue later on for them if there is a background check. If employee agrees, avoid recording the employment details. If the employee insists on salary, ask them to resign formally, serve the notice period as per the probation clause, and process their salary, PF, TDS, etc and issue a relieving letter.

I disagree here, since I hire mostly for Node.js dev for both freshers and senior roles in a start up. I often find it challenging to find quality candidate with JS experience and most of the top tier talent in our case for senior dev (in terms of their previous exp and project) have come from python background and have cracked out 3 rounds of tech interviews better than other folks from Java and JS. But we have also been able to find good JS candidates. So can‚Äôt say depends on the pool you are getting and the overall candidature than the tech stack solely. 

Also, salary here has nothing to do with the language but rather on the job role and requirement.

Adding what we did though it might differ from company to company on HR initiatives & Challenges:

1. Hiring Status : Offers made, Drop ratio, Joinings, Talent Pipeline, New Hiring requests and budgets required.
2. Attrion data
3. eNPS if  employee engagement surveys were done
4. Any employee feedbacks/concerns that mgmt should be aware of
5. Bonus / Performance pay / Successions planned.
6. Compliance related updates and Risk mgmt if any
7. Glassdoor/ Google review ratings or any other employer branding metrics
8.  New initiatives if required from People function and its impact, budgets required.

Hope this helpsüëç <This message was edited>

MBR are totally metrics driven, considering this is your first review you should take structured approach likewise, some of the slides can be as backup slides for subsequent meetings. 

1) Set the Context - Process Area/Function area/Project information, Team details, process flow, Scope, timelines etc.
2) Key Metrics - Yearly Targets --> followed by Quarterly Target.   
3) Target vs Actual Current Progress with supporting bullet points on key highlights of actual progress. Drawing some color codes R/B/Y to bench mark progress status is impactful
4) For Major Metrics drivers consider Highlighting them separately.  For Ex - out of $100 budget, $30 is consumed by XYZ, $ 20 by PQR
5) Action Plan for next quarter
6) Challenges anticipated with Mitigation Plan.  Do not forget to call out of support required if any.

sender: Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge
message:
Hi Folks,
We are planning to transition from 4 level rating system (Does not meet expectations, Meets expectations, Exceeds expectations and Exceptional)  to 5 level rating system 
1. Needs Development
2. Often Meets Expectations
3. Sometimes Exceeds Expectations
4. Always Exceeds Expectations
5. Exceptional / Sets a new Standard
Needed inputs from you all who are already on a 5 level rating system if this is running well in your org?
Is having Sometimes Exceeds expectations in 3rd place okay, and not taken as mean performance?
Needed guidance on pay for performance for these ratings.
Thank you folksüôèüòáü´°
What caused you to change it ?

sender: Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge
message: People who were just above meets expectations could not be placed in meets Or Exceeds expectations justfully. We wanted more granular assessment to help managers place a person appropriately.
Vijin V R HR Rebid: This message was deleted

In my prev. org, we transitioned from a 5 to a 6 scale rating for the same reasons. As there was not enough clarity where to place the one who often met expectations.
Although, for us, 1 and 2 were both performance intervention ratings (1 having graver implications like PIP).
So far you do not want that distinction, this 5 scale rating seems fine so far it solves your purpose.

Hi Team,
Any recommendations for recruitment agencies or partners to close a Business Development position with Advertisement and Marketing agency-specific experience.

All my orgs we always used 5 star rating system 
Our logic was to have precise buckets in which folks can get added <This message was edited>

If the company size is less than 200 - I would keep the ratings simple and invest more in managers to have them evaluate performance fair and right + ensure right communication is reaching people. Adding more buckets in my opinion seems to be a surface level problem solving where bucket 3 and bucket 4 are quite based on intuitions and not math (eg: what is sometimes , what is always? - often its a feeling unless supported by % of cases which is hard to gage for all projects)

If manager investment and standardization is hard such as huge company size where HRBPs are few in number, may be such fixes help for sometime :)

Agree with this. We had simplified to 3 ratings:
- Needs Improvement
- Meets expectations
- Exceeds expectations
More the options , more the confusion

sender: Shivani Pande Sr. Manager People Success Rocketium
message:
For similar reasons of keeping limited options for simplicity, we chose 4 levels:
- Way beyond expectations [Very few people get this]
- Above expectations

How do we define this make it the game changer and this info should be with everyone at the beginning of the year so that they are aware of the evaluation process.

Sourcing and screening:
Mass mailing and then to the interested candidates who responded, ask required details on mail, easy to filter by this way and then call only the best suited. Save the time to call everyone.
Job posting- again follow same approach to shortlist.
Interview Setup: 
Take 1-2 full day availability from panel and set as many interviews you can on those dates.
Interview rounds:
Ask panel to create a  questionnaire with minimum basic requirement to filter very poor candidates.
Keep assesment in second round to then filter the pool and proceed with required interview rounds. <This message was edited>

I‚Äôm looking to understand how different fintech and other companies handle employee trading compliance. Given the risk of insider trading, many firms restrict employees from trading on other platforms or impose specific guidelines.

I‚Äôd love to hear how your company approaches this‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs through pre-clearance requirements, restricted lists, blackout periods, mandatory disclosures, or other measures. Any insights on industry best practices would be really helpful. <This message was edited>

sender: Kiran Ksheersagar Senior TA Specialist Arcesium
message:
I am working in a similar domain.

During the onboarding process, candidates will go through  compliance training and they have to disclose their trading portfolios. We utilize designated brokers for the transfer of these portfolios.

Our trading requests are managed through a portal called StarCompliance. If an individual wishes to trade, they must submit a request via StarCompliance. Approval is typically granted within 15 minutes, provided the stock is not related to our which we are dealing with our clients (to avoid insider trading). Additionally, our policy prohibits intraday trading. Any stock purchased must remain in the portfolio for T+31 days.

I anticipate your next question may be about the consequences of failing to declare. During onboarding, employees sign a compliance form which authorizes audits. 

Annual audits are conducted for all employees.

---

Let me know if there's anything else you need!

Hey folks - need some inputs 

What are the expenses as a company we can consider while asking employees to relocate ? Like 
- Hotel for stay 
- ‚Å†travel 
How can we optimise on these expenses? 

Any inputs here appreciated üôåüèºThanks in advance.

You should consider the services of packers & movers as well.
To optimize, one thing that I can think of is you can partner with some hotel(s) for a stay as they might give a corporate discount, rather than reimbursing every single employee (which shall be expensive), if this is a mass relocation requirement.

1. One time relocation allowance to cover their relocation expenses.
2. Initial 10-15 days stay arrangement
3. Travel cost
To optimize, you can use service apartments instead of hotels or partner with hotels to negotiate corporate rates. Do not give reimbursement for packers and movers and set a fix sum to be given as allowances.
Cost of Packers & Movers, Hotel cost for a week and Real estate agent cost reimbursement to the employee (since the employee won't get much time to hunt for a rented accommodation).

sender: Akshatha B Raj HR ObjectWin Technology
message:
Hey folks!

We‚Äôre transitioning from Work From Home (WFH) to Work From Office (WFO) in the coming weeks, and I‚Äôd love to get some insights on how your teams managed this shift.

A few key questions:

- How did you handle the transition process?
- What was the timeline given for employees to move to a 5-day office schedule?
- For employees based in other cities, how much time were they given to relocate?
- Were any handbooks or documents shared to guide them through the transition?
- What benefits or perks were offered to support employees during this change?

Any input would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance! üòä

sender: Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared
message:
1. CXO announcement, HRBP cascade, manager cascade, open convo on transition timeline but clear expectation setting.
2. ‚Å†Start with 3 days with rotating depts and then transition to full 5 days within 2 months of announcement 
3. ‚Å†3 months with some cases in 5-6 months due to extraneous circumstances around them (based on performance as well)
4. ‚Å†Yes, a 4 pager
5. ‚Å†Complete relocation assistance - flights and 10 day accommodation for city transition for full family (booked by admin team) + relocation leave (3 days). Expecting parent employees given special session on transition in city. 
6. ‚Å†Going above and beyond requires making a list of collection of hottest restaurants, best schools near office, broker names and lists for office area nearby residential, tie ups and support from housing platforms like NoBroker for filing of brokerage slips that company reimburses within relocation kitty per person <This message was edited>
